Authors: En Jing Tian, Tolgor Bau, Yu Xiang Ding
Title:
A new species of Pholiota subgenus Flammuloides section
Lubricae (Strophariaceae, Agaricales) from Tibet, China
Abstract:
A new species from Tibet, Pholiota linzhiensis, is
proposed. Pholiota linzhiensis is recognized by its pileus covered with
radially appressed fibrillose squamules, stipe with subfloccose to
recurved scales; yellow and thick-walled pleurocystidia, as well as
oblong and sometimes pyriform spores. The species is described and
illustrated, and a phylogenetic analysis of internal transcribed spacer
nuclear ribosomal DNA (ITS) is presented. Both the morphology and the
phylogenetic analysis showed that P. linzhiensis belongs to Pholiota
subgenus Flammuloides section Lubricae.
